reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had an overnight stay as we were dining at Andrew Fairlie's @ Gleneagles to celebrate my husband's 50th. The proprietors had suggested a good taxi company and booked it for us in advance, which was most helpful. We were allocated Room 5, which was beautifully appointed and absolutely spotless. My only negative would be if you were staying for a few nights you might find it a little cramped as the en-suite had been built into the room. Double room (unfortunately a small double which we're not used to) and the pillows were a little hard, but otherwise a most comfortable stay. Extras were provided that you don't even always get at a good hotel, eg. bottles of mineral water, good tea/coffee making facilities with biscuits and cottonwool, etc, provided in the bathroom. Excellent breakfast - fruit juice, cereals, yoghurts, cheeses, and the cooked breakfast was lovely. I would recommend this B&B to anyone.
reviews.title: Excellent B&B, friendly & helpful proprietors

reviews.text: Visiting Scotland for a brief golfing holiday we decided to play at Gleneagles golf course. We spent the night here and were pleasantly surprised at the quality of rooms and proximity to Gleneagles. Gerry is an old hotelier with huge experience and it shows.
reviews.title: Perfect golfing getaway

reviews.text: There's not much I can add to the previous reviews. The hotel is very clean, modern, well run, free Wifi, great breakfast, easy access/parking and good value for money.
reviews.title: Perfect B&B

reviews.text: I would definately stay here again if/when i'm in the region
reviews.title: Perfect play to stay for a golfing break

reviews.text: A group of 4 of us stayed here on a golfing trip to Gleneagles. What a great place; welcoming hosts, very clean rooms, a central location for pubs etc. and a great breakfast. When we vacated the Guest House we went to play Auchterarder Golf Course, about a mile up the road. It transpired that one of us had left our shoes and a mobile phone in one of the rooms. The B & B host brought the items up to Golf Club, and the club pro gave them to us when we came off the Golf Course. Thanks Gerry - excellent service. I would recommend this place to anyone visiting the area.
reviews.title: Comfortable, stylish, very clean, great breakfast, with very welcoming hosts

reviews.text: My mother and I have been staying at Allandale for 9 years or so as my Granny is in residential care in Auchterarder. We stay 4 or 5 times a year and since Gerry and Lorraine have owned the property they have put a lot of effort into creating a first-class place to stay.
reviews.title: Great for little ones too!

reviews.title: Perfect retreat

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Forget your preconceptions about a bed & breakfast in a remote location. Allandale House provides a lovely retreat in a quiet locale. Loraine and Gerry were welcoming, friendly, attentive yet unobtrusive. The room was excellent with good decor, very clean and a bed that was very, very comfortable. We were to the rear of the property, it was very quiet and we slept like "dead logs"! Breakfast was excellent with a wide range of cereals and cooked options. My better half went for the full Scottish/English (all well grilled) while my poached eggs were spot on.
reviews.title: Poor bedroom lighting

reviews.text: I would say that our reception was good, the food very good, the bed comfortable, but the lighting in the room was dismal. Long life bulbs do not give good light. This 'fault' marred a very enoyable stay.
reviews.title: Beautiful room

description: If you're visiting Scotland and looking for a guest house right at the heart of things, a stay at Allandale House in Auchterarder is the perfect Perthshire choice. An Elegant Townhouse providing Bed & Breakfast in beautifully furnished guest rooms. All our rooms have Private Facilities with complimentary toiletries, Flat screen cable television with DVD player, Alarm Radio Clocks, Hospitality Trays, complimentary bottled water, Hair Dryers and Free Wireless Internet access. We are located 1.5 miles from the 2014 Ryder Cup venue at Gleneagles.
